sn15.7:4.2: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha …
sn15.7:4.7: how many eons have passed, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of eons.”
sn15.7:5.1: “But sir, can you give a simile?”
sn15.7:5.3: “Suppose there were four disciples with a lifespan of a hundred years.
sn15.7:5.4: And each day they would each recollect a hundred thousand eons.
sn15.7:5.5: Those four disciples would pass away after a hundred years and there would still be eons that they haven’t recollected.
sn15.7:5.6: That’s how many eons have passed.
sn15.7:5.8: how many eons have passed, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of eons.
sn15.7:5.11: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.”
